CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 12, 1953, pg. 15 reads: "Civil Defense Nursing Grads - Women are still continuing to pursue courses in interest of our country. The following women have recently completed courses in home nursing and civil defense and are now qualified to act in that capacity... The second class completed (above) included Mmes. Iola Hawkes, Evelyn Sadler, Nannie Jones, Harriet McDonald, Flora Godfrey, Sammy L. Scott, Gladys Lewis, Emuall Hurd, Annie M. Burton, Fontella V. Dixon, Alberta Jackson, Bernice Arrington, Ola M. Getter, Beatrice P. Webber, Ella Ward, Della Pinkard and Miss Rose Parker.  Classes were under the direction of Mrs. Eunice W. Cook, assistant director at Hill City Youth Municipality."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of graduating nurses for completion of in home nursing and civil defense classes, including: Iola Hawkes, Evelyn Sadler, Nannie Jones, Harriet McDonald, Flora Godfrey, Sammy L. Scott, Gladys Lewis, Emuall Hurd, Annie M. Burton, Fontella V. Dixon, Alberta Jackson, Bernice Arrington, Ola M. Getter, Beatrice P. Webber, Ella Ward, Della Pinkard, and Rose Parker, with Eunice Cook standing in center, gathered around table with Red Cross flag in interior with sign that reads "The Red Cross Services Home Nursing, Junior Red Cross, Nutrition Service First Aid"
